tit.cmt: 指示に従って補足説明を加えました。

sen.j: 会符（えふ）とは、江戸時代に朝廷・江戸幕府・公家・武家・寺社などが物資を輸送するにあたって、当該荷物の所属の明示のために付けられた荷札。
sen.e: Efu, a type of baggage tags, was attached to goods dispatched by the Imperial Court, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), court nobles, samurai families, temples and shrines to clarify who sent the baggage in question during the Edo period.

sen.cmt: ・定義文の形式に変更しました。・dispatchは「急送」のニュアンスがあるので、sendにしました。・during the Edo periodの係り先が不自然なため位置を変えました。

sen.j: 行李符・絵符・伝符などとも。
sen.e: It was also referred to as korifu (wicker trunk tag), efu (traffic tag), denpu (horse transportation tag).
sen.cmt: 「会符」と「絵符」は同じ発音ですが、そのまま音訳しました。

sen.e: It was also referred to as korifu (wicker trunk tag), efu (traffic tag, different kanji), or denpu (horse transportation tag).

sen.j: 朝廷・幕府のものは、菊や葵の御紋とともに墨書で「御用」とのみ書かれ、その他の場合は、紋章とともに「○○御用」「××家中÷÷御用」などと記された。
sen.e: Efu marked only "Goyo" (official business) in ink was attached to the baggage dispatched from the Imperial Court and the Edo bakufu accompanied by the Imperial crest and the family crest of Tokugawa, respectively, while other senders wrote "...Goyo"(official business of...", "...Kachu...Goyo"(...family's official business of..."on efu accompanied by their own family crests.

Efu marked only "Goyo" (official business) in ink was attached to the baggage sent from the Imperial Court or the Edo bakufu accompanied by the Imperial crest or the family crest of Tokugawa, respectively, while other senders wrote "...Goyo"(official business of...) or "...Kachu...Goyo"(...family's official business of...) on efu accompanied by their own family crests.
sen.cmt: ・dispatchは「急送」のニュアンスがあるので、sendにしました。・1つずつの荷物について言う場合、the Imperial Court and the Edo bakufuは、どちらかが送付元となるので、orでつなげるべきだと思います。・the Imperial crest andも同様です。・クォーテーションマークを修正しました。・Kachu…Goyoの前にはorが必要です。
sen.e: Efu marked only 'Goyo' (official business) in ink was attached to the baggage sent from the Imperial Court or the Edo bakufu accompanied by the Imperial crest or the family crest of Tokugawa, respectively, while other senders wrote '...Goyo' (official business of...) or '...Kachu...Goyo' (...family's official business of...) on efu accompanied by their own family crests.

sen.j: 会符の付いた荷物は宿駅の人馬を利用する際に幕府が定めた御定賃銭（おさだめちんせん）で輸送を受けられる特権を有した（なお、徳川将軍家の荷物（将軍家御用物）は無賃での輸送が義務付けられていた）。
sen.e: The Edo bakufu's official rate applied to the baggage with efu when human resources and horses were needed at shukueki (relay stations) (Tokugawa Shogunate Family's baggage [the Shogun Family's official baggage] had to be transported for free).

sen.j: ところが、18世紀中期以後、商品流通が盛んになる一方で、民間の輸送相場である相対賃銭（あいたいちんせん）と御定賃銭の格差が広がった。
sen.e: But after the middle of the eighteenth century, as commercial distribution became increasingly important, the disparity between the market rate of transportation and the official rate widened.

sen.j: そのため、公家や武家、寺社が金を取って商人や百姓に会符を貸し出して御定賃銭で輸送させることが行われたため、幕府はこうした行為をしばしば禁じたが、効果は無かった。
sen.e: Because, in line with this circumstance, court nobles, samurai families, temples and shrines started to earn money by lending efu to merchants and farmers who wanted to transport their own baggage at the official rate, the Edo bakufu often cracked down on this business, but without effect.
